meanings.def: to put something in liquid for a time so that it becomes completely wet; to become completely wet in this way
examples: soak something (in something) I usually soak the beans overnight.
If you soak the tablecloth before you wash it, the stains should come out.
soak something with something He soaked the cloth with petrol.
soak (in something) Leave the apricots to soak for 20 minutes.
I'm going to go and soak in the bath.
Soak the clothes in cold water.
A sudden shower of rain soaked the spectators.

meanings.def: to enter or pass through something
examples: soak through something Blood had soaked through the bandage.
The rain had soaked through every layer of his clothing.
soak into something Water dripped off the table and soaked into the carpet.

meanings.def: to obtain a lot of money from somebody by making them pay very high taxes or prices
examples: He was accused of soaking his clients.

meanings.def: an act of leaving something in a liquid for a period of time; an act of making somebody/something wet
examples: Give the shirt a good soak before you wash it.

meanings.def: a period of time spent in a bath
examples: Relax with a nice long soak in a hot bath.
